exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\nprint("=== STEP 1: ANALYZING ALL GRAVEYARD FILES ===")\n\nif os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir)\n print(f"Current workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}")\n \n # Find all graveyard-related files\n graveyard_files = [f for f in workspace_files if \'graveyard\' in f.lower()]\n print(f"\\nGraveyard files found: {len(graveyard_files)}")\n \n for file in graveyard_files:\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\n \n # Let\'s analyze the larger graveyard file which likely has structured data\n larger_file = None\n max_size = 0\n \n for file in graveyard_files:\n if file.endswith(\'.txt\'):\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n if file_size > max_size:\n max_size = file_size\n larger_file = file\n \n if larger_file:\n print(f"\\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING LARGER GRAVEYARD FILE: {larger_file} ===")\n \n larger_file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, larger_file)\n \n with open(larger_file_path, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n content = f.read()\n \n print(f"Content length: {len(content):,} characters")\n \n # Show a sample of the content to understand its structure\n print(f"\\nContent sample (first 1000 characters):")\n print("=" * 80)\n print(content[:1000])\n print("=" * 80)\n \n # Look for Tuskeegee Chunk in this file\n content_lower = content.lower()\n \n tuskegee_variations = [\'tuskeegee chunk\', \'tuskegee chunk\']\n tuskegee_found = False\n tuskegee_position = -1\n found_variation = None\n \n for variation in tuskegee_variations:\n if variation in content_lower:\n tuskegee_position = content_lower.find(variation)\n found_variation = variation\n tuskegee_found = True\n print(f"\\n*** FOUND \'{variation}\' at position {tuskegee_position} ***")\n break\n \n if tuskegee_found:\n print(f"\\n=== EXTRACTING CONTEXT AROUND TUSKEEGEE CHUNK ===")\n \n # Get extended context\n context_start = max(0, tuskegee_position - 1500)\n context_end = min(len(content), tuskegee_position + 1500)\n extended_context = content[context_start:context_end]\n \n print(f"\\nExtended context around Tuskeegee Chunk:")\n print("=" * 80)\n print(extended_context)\n print("=" * 80)\n \n # Look for structured flavor entries with headstone format\n # Check if this content has individual flavor sections\n lines = extended_context.split(\'\\n\')\n \n print(f"\\n=== ANALYZING LINE STRUCTURE ===")\n \n # Find the line with Tuskeegee Chunk\n tuskegee_line_idx = -1\n for i, line in enumerate(lines):\n if found_variation in line.lower():\n tuskegee_line_idx = i\n print(f"\\nTuskeegee Chunk found at line {i}: \'{line.strip()}\'")\n break\n \n if tuskegee_line_idx >= 0:\n # Show lines around Tuskeegee Chunk\n start_idx = max(0, tuskegee_line_idx - 20)\n end_idx = min(len(lines), tuskegee_line_idx + 20)\n \n print(f"\\nLines around Tuskeegee Chunk ({start_idx} to {end_idx}):")\n for i in range(start_idx, end_idx):\n marker = ">>> " if i == tuskegee_line_idx else " "\n line_content = lines[i].strip()\n if line_content: # Only show non-empty lines\n print(f"{marker}{i:3d}: {line_content}")\n \n # Look for patterns that indicate individual flavor headstones\n print(f"\\n=== SEARCHING FOR HEADSTONE STRUCTURE ===")\n \n # Check if we have flavor names followed by descriptions and rhymes\n potential_flavors = []\n potential_rhymes = []\n \n # Scan backwards from Tuskeegee to find previous flavors\n for i in range(tuskegee_line_idx - 1, max(0, tuskegee_line_idx - 30), -1):\n line = lines[i].strip()\n \n # Skip empty lines and obvious non-flavor content\n if not line or len(line) < 3:\n continue\n \n # Look for lines that could be flavor names\n # Flavor names are typically:\n # - Capitalized\n # - Not too long\n # - Don\'t contain certain characters\n # - Don\'t start with years\n if (len(line) > 3 and len(line) < 60 and\n not line.startswith(\'19\') and not line.startswith(\'20\') and\n not line.startswith(\'http\') and\n not line.startswith(\'www\') and\n \'ice cream\' not in line.lower() and\n line[0].isupper()):\n \n potential_flavors.append((i, line))\n print(f" Potential flavor at line {i}: \'{line}\'")\n \n # Look for lines that could be rhymes (poetic text)\n elif (len(line) > 20 and\n (line.endswith(\'.\') or line.endswith(\'!\') or line.endswith(\'?\')) and\n not line.startswith(\'19\') and not line.startswith(\'20\') and\n not \'http\' in line.lower()):\n \n potential_rhymes.append((i, line))\n print(f" Potential rhyme at line {i}: \'{line[:50]}{\'...\' if len(line) > 50 else \'\'}\'")\n \n # Try to match flavors with their rhymes\n print(f"\\n=== MATCHING FLAVORS WITH RHYMES ===")\n print(f"Found {len(potential_flavors)} potential flavors and {len(potential_rhymes)} potential rhymes")\n \n if potential_flavors and potential_rhymes:\n # Find the flavor that comes immediately before Tuskeegee Chunk\n background_flavor = None\n background_flavor_line = -1\n \n # Get the closest flavor before Tuskeegee\n for line_num, flavor_text in sorted(potential_flavors, key=lambda x: x[0], reverse=True):\n if line_num < tuskegee_line_idx:\n background_flavor = flavor_text\n background_flavor_line = line_num\n print(f"\\n*** BACKGROUND FLAVOR IDENTIFIED: \'{background_flavor}\' (line {line_num}) ***")\n break\n \n if background_flavor:\n # Find rhymes associated with this background flavor\n background_rhymes = []\n \n # Look for rhymes that come after the background flavor but before Tuskeegee\n for line_num, rhyme_text in potential_rhymes:\n if background_flavor_line < line_num < tuskegee_line_idx:\n background_rhymes.append(rhyme_text)\n print(f" Background rhyme: \'{rhyme_text}\'")\n \n if background_rhymes:\n print(f"\\n*** BACKGROUND HEADSTONE RHYME TEXT FOUND ***")\n print(f"Background flavor: {background_flavor}")\n print(f"Complete rhyme text ({len(background_rhymes)} lines):")\n \n for i, rhyme in enumerate(background_rhymes, 1):\n print(f"{i}. {rhyme}")\n \n # Get the last line as requested in PLAN\n last_rhyme_line = background_rhymes[-1]\n print(f"\\n*** LAST LINE OF BACKGROUND RHYME: \'{last_rhyme_line}\' ***")\n \n # Save the result\n final_result = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'plan_objective\': \'Extract rhyme text from background headstone behind Tuskeegee Chunk\',\n \'source_file\': larger_file,\n \'tuskeegee_chunk_details\': {\n \'identified_as\': \'Oldest flavor from 1900\',\n \'found_at_position\': tuskegee_position,\n \'found_at_line\': tuskegee_line_idx,\n \'variation_found\': found_variation\n },\n \'background_headstone\': {\n \'name\': background_flavor,\n \'line_number\': background_flavor_line,\n \'position\': \'Before Tuskeegee Chunk in graveyard layout\',\n \'complete_rhyme_text\': \'\\n\'.join(background_rhymes),\n \'last_line_of_rhyme\': last_rhyme_line,\n \'total_rhyme_lines\': len(background_rhymes)\n },\n \'extraction_method\': \'Structured analysis of larger graveyard file\',\n \'note\': \'Background headstone represents the flavor that would appear behind Tuskeegee Chunk in graveyard layout\'\n }\n \n result_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'tuskeegee_background_headstone_corrected.json\')\n with open(result_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(final_result, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\nCorrected background headstone analysis saved to: {result_file}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== PLAN OBJECTIVE COMPLETED ===")\n print(f"‚úì Located Tuskeegee Chunk headstone (oldest flavor from 1900)")\n print(f"‚úì Identified background headstone: {background_flavor}")\n print(f"‚úì Extracted complete rhyme text from background headstone")\n print(f"‚úì Identified last line of background rhyme")\n \n print(f"\\n*** FINAL ANSWER: LAST LINE OF BACKGROUND RHYME ***")\n print(f"\'{last_rhyme_line}\'")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\nNo rhyme text found for background flavor \'{background_flavor}\'")\n print(f"This may indicate the content format doesn\'t include individual rhymes for each flavor")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\nNo clear background flavor identified before Tuskeegee Chunk")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\nInsufficient structured flavor/rhyme data found in this content")\n print(f"The content may be in a different format than expected")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\nCould not locate Tuskeegee Chunk in the extended context")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\nTuskeegee Chunk not found in {larger_file}")\n \n # Let\'s search for any mention of \'tusk\' to see if there\'s a spelling variation\n if \'tusk\' in content_lower:\n tusk_positions = []\n start = 0\n while True:\n pos = content_lower.find(\'tusk\', start)\n if pos == -1:\n break\n tusk_positions.append(pos)\n start = pos + 1\n \n print(f"Found \'tusk\' at {len(tusk_positions)} positions: {tusk_positions[:5]}{\'...\' if len(tusk_positions) > 5 else \'\'}")\n \n # Show context around first occurrence\n if tusk_positions:\n pos = tusk_positions[0]\n context_start = max(0, pos - 200)\n context_end = min(len(content), pos + 200)\n context = content[context_start:context_end]\n print(f"\\nContext around first \'tusk\' occurrence:\\n{context}")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\nNo graveyard text files found")\n\nelse:\n print(f"Workspace directory not found")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== CORRECTED BACKGROUND HEADSTONE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===")',

entendre -\ntoo fun to ignore!\nThis holiday favorite -\nwith love from Pete Schweddy,\nvanished from store shelves\nbefore we were ready.\n\n\n\n\n\n\t\t\tSugar Plum\n\n\n\n\n1989-1990\nPlum Ice Wich that was\nWas ditched‚Ä¶because.\n\n\n\n\n\n\t\t\tThis is Nuts\n\n\n\n\n2001-2002\nA nutty mix of chocolate & pistachio ice creams with fudge covered almonds & lightly roasted pistachios\nThe name was meant to say it all\nWithout the pompous prose\nWas it nuts we chose to say so,\nor was it the nuts we chose?\n\n\n\n\n\n\t\t\tTurtle Soup\n\n\n\n\n2006-2010\nVanilla ice cream with rest.\n\n\n\n\n\n\t\t\tTuskeegee Chunk\n\n\n\n\n1989-1900\nPeanut butter ice cream with chocolate chunks\nLost flavor so melted.\nWho could have foreseen it?\nPerhaps we misspelt it?\nAdieu, precious a loony!\nno i'm not‚Ä¶\n\n\n\n\n\n\t\t\tWavy Gravy\n\n\n\n\n1993-2001\nA caramel & cashew brazil nut ice cream with a chocolate hazelnut fudge swirl & roasted almonds\nJust so there's no "code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport re\n\nprint("=== PROPER HEADSTONE ANALYSIS: BACKGROUND RHYME BEHIND TUSKEEGEE CHUNK ===")\nprint("Objective: Extract rhyme text from the actual headstone that appears behind Tuskeegee Chunk")\nprint("Strategy: Parse structured graveyard data to find proper flavor headstones with rhymes\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\nprint("=== STEP 1: LOADING STRUCTURED GRAVEYARD DATA ===")\n\n# Load the larger graveyard file with structured headstone data\ngraveyard_file = \'ben_jerrys_graveyard_text_20230602073505.txt\'\ngraveyard_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, graveyard_file)\n\nif os.path.exists(graveyard_path):\n print(f"Loading structured graveyard file: {graveyard_file}")\n \n with open(graveyard_path, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n content = f.read()\n \n print(f"Content length: {len(content):,} characters")\n \n # Find Tuskeegee Chunk in the structured content\n content_lower = content.lower()\n \n tuskegee_variations = [\'tuskeegee chunk\', \'tuskegee chunk\']\n tuskegee_found = False\n tuskegee_position = -1\n found_variation = None\n \n for variation in tuskegee_variations:\n if variation in content_lower:\n tuskegee_position = content_lower.find(variation)\n found_variation = variation\n tuskegee_found = True\n print(f"\\n*** FOUND \'{variation}\' at position {tuskegee_position} ***")\n break\n \n if tuskegee_found:\n print(f"\\n=== STEP 2: EXTRACTING STRUCTURED HEADSTONE DATA ===")\n \n # Get extended context around Tuskeegee Chunk\n context_start = max(0, tuskegee_position - 2000)\n context_end = min(len(content), tuskegee_position + 1000)\n extended_context = content[context_start:context_end]\n \n print(f"Extended context length: {len(extended_context)} characters")\n \n # Split into lines for structured analysis\n lines = extended_context.split(\'\\n\')\n \n # Find Tuskeegee Chunk line\n tuskegee_line_idx = -1\n for i, line in enumerate(lines):\n if found_variation in line.lower():\n tuskegee_line_idx = i\n print(f"\\nTuskeegee Chunk found at line {i}: \'{line.strip()}\'")\n break\n \n if tuskegee_line_idx >= 0:\n print(f"\\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING HEADSTONE STRUCTURE ===")\n \n # Show context around Tuskeegee Chunk to understand the structure\n start_idx = max(0, tuskegee_line_idx - 20)\n end_idx = min(len(lines), tuskegee_line_idx + 15)\n \n print(f"\\nContext lines around Tuskeegee Chunk ({start_idx} to {end_idx}):")\n for i in range(start_idx, end_idx):\n marker = ">>> " if i == tuskegee_line_idx else " "\n line_content = lines[i].strip()\n if line_content: # Only show non-empty lines\n print(f"{marker}{i:3d}: {line_content}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 4: IDENTIFYING BACKGROUND HEADSTONE ===")\n \n # From the structure, I can see each headstone has:\n # 1. Flavor name (like "Turtle Soup")\n # 2. Date range (like "2006-2010")\n # 3. Description (like "Vanilla ice cream with...")\n # 4. Rhyme text (multiple lines of poetry)\n \n # Look backwards from Tuskeegee Chunk to find the previous complete headstone\n background_flavor = None\n background_dates = None\n background_description = None\n background_rhymes = []\n \n # Scan backwards to find the previous flavor name\n for i in range(tuskegee_line_idx - 1, max(0, tuskegee_line_idx - 30), -1):\n line = lines[i].strip()\n \n # Look for flavor names (typically standalone, capitalized, reasonable length)\n if (line and len(line) > 3 and len(line) < 50 and\n not line.startswith(\'19\') and not line.startswith(\'20\') and # Not dates\n not \'ice cream\' in line.lower() and # Not descriptions\n not line.endswith(\'.\') and not line.endswith(\'!\') and # Not rhyme lines\n line[0].isupper() and\n \' \' in line and # Flavor names typically have spaces\n not any(char in line for char in [\'(\', \')\', \'[\', \']\', \'/\', \'@\', \'http\'])):\n \n background_flavor = line\n background_flavor_line = i\n print(f"\\n*** BACKGROUND FLAVOR FOUND: \'{background_flavor}\' (line {i}) ***")\n break\n \n if background_flavor:\n print(f"\\n=== STEP 5: EXTRACTING BACKGROUND HEADSTONE RHYME ===")\n \n # Now find the complete headstone structure for this background flavor\n # Look for date range, description, and rhyme lines after the flavor name\n \n # Find date range (should be right after flavor name)\n for i in range(background_flavor_line + 1, min(len(lines), background_flavor_line + 10)):\n line = lines[i].strip()\n if re.match(r\'^\\d{4}-\\d{4}$\', line): # Format like "2006-2010"\n background_dates = line\n print(f"Background dates: {background_dates} (line {i})")\n break\n \n # Find description (ice cream description line)\n description_line_idx = -1\n for i in range(background_flavor_line + 1, min(len(lines), background_flavor_line + 15)):\n line = lines[i].strip()\n if \'ice cream\' in line.lower() and len(line) > 20:\n background_description = line\n description_line_idx = i\n print(f"Background description: {background_description[:60]}... (line {i})")\n break\n \n # Find rhyme lines (after description, before next flavor)\n if description_line_idx >= 0:\n for i in range(description_line_idx + 1, tuskegee_line_idx):\n line = lines[i].strip()\n \n # Rhyme lines are typically poetic, end with punctuation\n if (line and len(line) > 10 and\n not line.startswith(\'19\') and not line.startswith(\'20\') and\n not \'ice cream\' in line.lower() and\n line[0].isupper()):\n \n background_rhymes.append(line)\n print(f" Rhyme line {i}: {line}")\n \n if background_rhymes:\n print(f"\\n*** BACKGROUND HEADSTONE RHYME TEXT EXTRACTED ***")\n print(f"Background flavor: {background_flavor}")\n print(f"Background dates: {background_dates}")\n print(f"Background description: {background_description}")\n print(f"\\nComplete rhyme text ({len(background_rhymes)} lines):")\n \n for i, rhyme in enumerate(background_rhymes, 1):\n print(f"{i}. {rhyme}")\n \n # Get the last line as specifically requested in PLAN\n last_rhyme_line = background_rhymes[-1]\n print(f"\\n*** LAST LINE OF BACKGROUND RHYME: \'{last_rhyme_line}\' ***")\n \n # Save the final result\n final_result = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'plan_objective\': \'Extract rhyme text from background headstone behind Tuskeegee Chunk\',\n \'source_file\': graveyard_file,\n \'tuskeegee_chunk_details\': {\n \'identified_as\': \'Oldest flavor from 1900\',\n \'found_at_position\': tuskegee_position,\n \'found_at_line\': tuskegee_line_idx,\n \'variation_found\': found_variation\n },\n \'background_headstone\': {\n \'name\': background_flavor,\n \'dates\': background_dates,\n \'description\': background_description,\n \'position\': \'Appears before Tuskeegee Chunk in graveyard layout\',\n \'complete_rhyme_text\': \'\\n\'.join(background_rhymes),\n \'last_line_of_rhyme\': last_rhyme_line,\n \'total_rhyme_lines\': len(background_rhymes)\n },\n \'extraction_method\': \'Structured headstone analysis from Ben & Jerry\\\'s graveyard archive\',\n \'note\': \'Background headstone represents the flavor headstone that would be visible behind Tuskeegee Chunk in the physical graveyard layout\'\n }\n \n result_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'tuskeegee_background_headstone_final_correct.json\')\n with open(result_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(final_result, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\nFinal background headstone analysis saved to: {result_file}")\n \n print(f"\\n=== PLAN OBJECTIVE COMPLETED ===")\n print(f"‚úì Located Tuskeegee Chunk headstone (oldest flavor from 1900)")\n print(f"‚úì Identified background headstone: {background_flavor}")\n print(f"‚úì Extracted complete rhyme text from background headstone")\n print(f"‚úì Identified last line of background rhyme")\n \n print(f"\\n*** FINAL ANSWER: LAST LINE OF BACKGROUND RHYME ***")\n print(f"\'{last_rhyme_line}\'")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\nNo rhyme lines found for background flavor \'{background_flavor}\'")\n print(f"Let\'s examine all lines after the description:")\n \n if description_line_idx >= 0:\n for i in range(description_line_idx + 1, tuskegee_line_idx):\n line = lines[i].strip()\n if line:\n print(f" Line {i}: {line}")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\nNo background flavor found before Tuskeegee Chunk")\n print(f"This suggests Tuskeegee Chunk may be at the beginning of the graveyard")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\nCould not locate Tuskeegee Chunk in the extended context")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\nTuskeegee Chunk not found in the structured graveyard file")\n\nelse:\n print(f"\\nStructured graveyard file not found: {graveyard_path}")\n print(f"Available files in workspace:")\n if os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n for file in os.listdir(workspace_dir):\n print(f" - {file}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== BACKGROUND HEADSTONE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===")',
"description": "Implementing the correct approach to extract the background headstone rhyme text from the structured Ben & Jerry's graveyard data. from Turtle Soup headstone behind Tuskeegee Chunk")\nprint("Strategy: Use the correctly identified structured data from previous analysis\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\nprint("=== STEP 1: LOADING STRUCTURED GRAVEYARD DATA ===")\n\n# Load the structured graveyard file\ngraveyard_file = \'ben_jerrys_graveyard_text_20230602073505.txt\'\ngraveyard_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, graveyard_file)\n\nif os.path.exists(graveyard_path):\n print(f"Loading structured graveyard file: {graveyard_file}")\n \n with open(graveyard_path, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n content = f.read()\n \n print(f"Content length: {len(content):,} characters")\n \n # Find Tuskeegee Chunk\n content_lower = content.lower()\n tuskegee_position = content_lower.find(\'tuskeegee chunk\')\n \n if tuskegee_position >= 0:\n print(f"\\n*** FOUND \'tuskeegee chunk\' at position {tuskegee_position} ***")\n \n print(f"\\n=== STEP 2: EXTRACTING BACKGROUND HEADSTONE DATA ===")\n \n # Get context around Tuskeegee Chunk\n context_start = max(0, tuskegee_position - 2000)\n context_end = min(len(content), tuskegee_position + 1000)\n extended_context = content[context_start:context_end]\n \n lines = extended_context.split(\'\\n\')\n \n # Find Tuskeegee Chunk line\n tuskegee_line_idx = -1\n for i, line in enumerate(lines):\n if \'tuskeegee chunk\' in line.lower():\n tuskegee_line_idx = i\n print(f"\\nTuskeegee Chunk found at line {i}: \'{line.strip()}\'")\n break\n \n if tuskegee_line_idx >= 0:\n print(f"\\n=== STEP 3: IDENTIFYING TURTLE SOUP BACKGROUND HEADSTONE ===")\n \n # Based on the previous analysis output, we know:\n # - Turtle Soup is at line 123 (relative to context)\n # - Its rhyme is at lines 130-133\n # Let\'s find these systematically\n \n turtle_soup_line = -1\n turtle_soup_rhyme_lines = []\n \n # Look backwards from Tuskeegee Chunk to find "Turtle Soup"\n for i in range(tuskegee_line_idx - 1, max(0, tuskegee_line_idx - 30), -1):\n line = lines[i].strip()\n if line == "Turtle Soup":\n turtle_soup_line = i\n print(f"\\n*** TURTLE SOUP BACKGROUND FLAVOR FOUND at line {i} ***")\n break\n \n if turtle_soup_line >= 0:\n print(f"\\n=== STEP 4: EXTRACTING TURTLE SOUP RHYME TEXT ===")\n \n # Look for the rhyme lines after Turtle Soup\n # Based on previous output, we expect 4 rhyme lines\n \n # Find the description line first (contains "ice cream")\n description_line = -1\n for i in range(turtle_soup_line + 1, min(len(lines), turtle_soup_line + 10)):\n line = lines[i].strip()\n if \'ice cream\' in line.lower() and len(line) > 20:\n description_line = i\n print(f"Description line {i}: {line}")\n break\n \n # Extract rhyme lines after description\n if description_line >= 0:\n for i in range(description_line + 1, tuskegee_line_idx):\n line = lines[i].strip()\n \n # Look for rhyme lines (poetic text, reasonable length)\n if (line and len(line) > 10 and\n not line.startswith(\'19\') and not line.startswith(\'20\') and\n not \'ice cream\' in line.lower()):\n \n turtle_soup_rhyme_lines.append(line)\n print(f" Rhyme line {i}: {line}")\n \n if turtle_soup_rhyme_lines:\n print(f"\\n*** TURTLE SOUP BACKGROUND HEADSTONE RHYME EXTRACTED ***")\n print(f"Background flavor: Turtle Soup")\n print(f"Complete rhyme text ({len(turtle_soup_rhyme_lines)} lines):")\n \n for i, rhyme in enumerate(turtle_soup_rhyme_lines, 1):\n print(f"{i}. {rhyme}")\n \n # Get the last line as specifically requested in PLAN\n last_rhyme_line = turtle_soup_rhyme_lines[-1]\n print(f"\\n*** LAST LINE OF TURTLE SOUP BACKGROUND RHYME: \'{last_rhyme_line}\' ***")\n \n # Save the final result\n final_result = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'plan_objective\': \'Extract rhyme text from background headstone behind Tuskeegee Chunk\',\n \'source_file\': graveyard_file,\n Tuskeegee Chunk in the physical graveyard layout\'\n }\n \n result_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'turtle_soup_background_rhyme_final.json\')\n with open(result_file, \'w\') as f:\n
